questions.text: A 20-year-old man presents with 6-week painless enlargement of cervical nodes with rubbery consistency, fever, weight loss and loss of appetite. Excisional node biopsy is shown below. Which of the following is correct about this case?

choices.text: Sarcoidosis with non-caseating granulomas and elevated ACE
Cat-scratch disease with stellate suppurative granulomas
Hodgkin lymphoma with classical RS cells

questions.text: A 2-year-old child is having recurrent pneumonia episodes. Examination shows delayed dentition. Labs show increased Ig E levels and eosinophilia. Which of the following conditions is the cause of this presentation?
Which of the following cells is primarily responsible for producing circulating antibodies in response to an antigen?

A 12-year-old boy with rheumatic fever is receiving benzathine penicillin prophylaxis. Shortly after the injection, he develops generalized urticaria, facial swelling, hypotension, and difficulty breathing. Which of the following immunological mechanisms is primarily responsible for his reaction?
Which of the following histopathological findings is seen in liver biopsy of a diabetic patient with HbA1c of 12%?

A 50-year-old man presents to the OPD with heart burn and cough and a 25-year history of smoking 2 packs daily. Which of the following epithelial transformations can occur in the lungs of this patient?
Hemosiderin laden intra-alveolar macrophages will be seen in which of the following conditions?

choices.text: Hemochromatosis due to recurrent packed RBC transfusion

questions.text: Patient presents with pitting pedal oedema for the past 2 weeks. Labs: LFT = normal, serum albumin= 2 gm/dl, KFT= deranged with massive proteinuria, Hb A1c 10% and Echo report is normal. USG abdomen shows bilaterally enlarged kidneys. Kidney biopsy was done. Which of the following histopathological reports is most likely to be seen?

choices.text: Apple green birefringence for Congo red deposits

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct about T lymphocytes?

choices.text: Responsible for type IV hypersensitivity reaction
Concentrated in germinal centres of lymph nodes

questions.text:
Liver biopsy of a patient with jaundice and elevated liver enzymes for 6 months was performed. The patient is an IV drug user. Serology shows

HBsAg Positive, HBe Ag positive

IgM anti HBc negative

IgG anti HBc positive

Which is the most likely finding to be seen

35-year-old female with progressive limb weakness and muscle wasting for the past 1 year. On examination tongue fasciculations and hypertonia in arms is noted. The sensory system is intact. She is diagnosed as having amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Which of the following will be seen in motor neurons of this patient?
All of the following changes are seen in reversible cell injury except?
“Ghost cells” are seen in which of the following conditions?
Which of the following is not a pro-apoptotic regulator?
Which is correct about Superoxide dismutase?

choices.text: Degenerate hydrogen peroxide to hydroxyl groups

questions.text: A 6-month-old male infant presents with sparse, kinky hair, hypotonia, and developmental delay. Laboratory tests reveal low serum copper and ceruloplasmin levels. Which of the following is correct about this condition?

choices.text: ATP 7A defect with increased Cu/Zn-superoxide dismutase activity
ATP 7A defect with decreased Cu/Zn-superoxide dismutase activity
ATP 7B defect with increased Cu/Zn-superoxide dismutase activity
ATP 7B defect with decreased Cu/Zn-superoxide dismutase activity

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct about diapedesis?

choices.text: Most important adhesion molecule is CD 31
In lungs it occurs via capillaries
Bi-directional movement of WBC that perform phagocytosis

questions.text: A 3-month-old male infant presents with recurrent skin infections without pus formation, delayed umbilical cord separation, and oral ulcers. Laboratory tests reveal marked leucocytosis with neutrophilia. Which of the following is the most likely defect in this patient?

A 5-year-old boy presents with recurrent skin and respiratory infections, silvery-gray hair, and light-coloured eyes. On examination, he has mild ataxia. Peripheral blood smear is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely defect in this patient?

choices.text: Defective NADPH oxidase and impaired respiratory burst
Defective lysosomal trafficking and impaired phagolysosome formation
Defective β2 integrin and impaired neutrophil adhesion
STAT3 mutation and impaired Th17 differentiation

questions.text: Which of the following is not correct about chronic granulomatous disease?

choices.text: Increased infection with S. Aureus and Burkholderia Cepacia
More common in girls than boys

questions.text: Which of the following antibodies cannot fix the complement system?
A 25-year-old young female presents with ptosis showing diurnal variation. CT chest shows anterior mediastinal mass identified as thymus gland cancer. Which receptor is affected in this patient?

choices.text: Antibody against nicotinic receptors at the motor end plate
Antibody against muscarinic receptor at motor end plate
Antibody against voltage gated calcium channels at motor end plate

questions.text: A farmer was returning from the field in the evening when he was bitten by a snake. On arrival to CHC he has ptosis, difficulty in counting up to 10 and areflexia. 20 vials of ASV were given. 5 days later he develops fever, extensive rash and arthralgia at all the large joints in the body. Which type of hypersensitivity reaction is seen here?

A 35-year-old male with lepromatous leprosy presents with fever, painful erythematous nodules on the skin, joint pain, and swelling 3 months after starting multidrug therapy. Which type of hypersensitivity reaction is most likely responsible for his current symptoms?
A 65-year-old man presents with progressive anaemia and cervical lymphadenopathy. P. Smear is shown below. Which CD markers are seen in this case?

12-year-old presents with fever, weight loss and painless cervical lymphadenopathy. Lymph node biopsy stained with H&E has hallmark cells. The diagnosis of anaplastic large cell lymphoma was made. Most likely translocation?

A young boy presents with a history of ingestion of paint chips, leaves, and soil. A blood examination is conducted. Based on the clinical history and suspected environmental exposure, what is the most likely pathology?
Bernard-Soulier syndrome is caused by a defect in which of the following platelet glycoproteins?

A 30 year-old man presents with periorbital oedema. Urine examination shows massive proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia. He undergoes a kidney biopsy and Congo red staining shows apple-green birefringence under polarized light. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A newborn presents with upward slanting palpebral fissures, flat facial profile and  hypotonia, Karyotyping shows a 5p deletion. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old woman presents with lower abdominal discomfort. There is no vaginal discharge. USG abdomen shows an ovarian mass. Post surgical image of resected tumour is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 16-year-old girl presents to the ER with fever, severe headache, neck stiffness, and purpuric rash. Lumbar puncture is performed, and CSF analysis shows turbid fluid with low glucose, elevated protein, and 1000 neutrophils/mm³. Gram stain demonstrates gram-negative diplococci. On further history, it is noted that the patient has had multiple hospital admissions in the past for similar episodes of severe bacterial meningitis.

Which of the following is the most likely underlying reason for his recurrent infections?
All of the following act as opsonins to enhance phagocytosis except?
Koilocytosis is caused by which of the following conditions?

A 35-year-old patient undergoes a biopsy of a retroperitoneal mass. Histopathology shows “nests of cells in zellballen pattern” surrounded by sustentacular cells. Which of the following investigations is most useful for biochemical confirmation?

Histology of the excised mitral valve shows fibrinoid necrosis surrounded by mononuclear cells and palisading histiocytes along with Anitschkow cells in the myocardium. Which of the following is the cause of this presentation?

choices.text: Molecular mimicry between Beta- myosin heavy chains and M proteins
Infection of myocardium with Streptococcus pyogenes

questions.text: Which is correct about malakoplakia?

choices.text: White patch in oral cavity due to gutka chewing
Red patch in oral cavity due to gutka chewing
Chronic gastritis with extra cellular urease positive organisms

questions.text: Gamma Gandy bodies are seen in
Which of the following is correct about the rosettes in the slides shown below

choices.text: A= Homer Wright, B= Flexner Winter Steiner
A= Flexner Winter Steiner, B= Homer Wright
A= True ependymal, B= Homer wright
A= Homer Wright, B= True ependymal

questions.text: Which of the following is a hallmark feature of malignancy?
Which of the following is the most common benign lung tumour?

A- 60-year-old lady presents with cachexia and gross abdominal distention. On examination, fluid thrill and shifting dullness is noted. Ascitic tap shows malignant cells. Which of the following is the leading cause?

60-year-old patient develops cough and weight loss for the last 3 months. Biopsy of lung mass shows expression of chromogranin and synaptophysin. Which paraneoplastic syndrome will most likely occur in this patient?

A 60-year-old man presents with obstructive jaundice. On examination palpable gall bladder is felt in RUQ. MRCP shows an ill-defined 3X 4 cm mass in the head of the pancreas. Which of the following tumour suppressor genes is most likely responsible for this presentation?

A 30-year-old construction worker presents with shortness of breath. CXR is shown below. It was taken after pleural tapping that showed bloody pleural effusion. Which of the following is the cause of this presentation?
Hormone responsive liver tumour?
Which is correct about the Klatskin tumor?

choices.text: Cholangiocarcinoma at common hepatic duct bifurcation
Angiosarcoma caused by exposure of polyvinyl chloride

questions.text: A Young girl presents with chronic diarrhoea and abdominal pain episodes. On examination she has mucocutaneous pigmentation on lips. Endoscopic ultrasound shows polyps in the jejunum. Which of the following is correct about this condition?

choices.text: Gluten elimination from diet will improve her pigmentation and diarrhoea

questions.text: Napkin ring configuration stricture in bowel is seen in which of the following conditions

A 30-year-old man presents with painless testis enlargement for the last 6 months. Work up was done and high inguinal orchidectomy was done. Resected specimen and histology slide is shown. Which of the following is correct about this tumor?

choices.text: Germ cell tumor with raised PLAP
Germ cell tumor with raised PAP
Germ cell tumor with raised HCG
Germ cell tumor with raised AFP

questions.text: A 70 year old man presents with a low back ache. MRI shows lytic lesions in the LS spine. DRE shows nodularity in the posterior lobe of the prostate. Which of the following tests will help in confirming the diagnosis of this case?
Pseudogaucher cells on Bone marrow aspiration with low LAP score is seen in which of the following conditions

A 40 year old man is having recurrent epistaxis, hematuria episodes since last one month. On examination he has petechiae, purpura on lower limbs. Work up shows Hb: 7 gm%, TLC: 3000/cu.mm, Platelet count: 10,000/ cu.mm. P.smear is shown below. Which of the following is the cause of this presentation?
Which of the following is the most common type of non hodgkin lymphoma?
A 60-year-old female presents with weakness, back pain and repeated infections. Work up shows M spike on serum electrophoresis. Prognosis is determined by which of the following?

An 8 month old boy is having bilateral knee haemarthosis. Mother tells of easy bruisability in a child. Work up shows BT normal, PT normal and aPTT is deranged. Gene sequencing shows F8 gene mutation. What is the best treatment for this patient to prevent recurrence of these bleeds
A 2 year old child is admitted with recurrent pneumonia episodes and steatorrhea. You are suspecting mucoviscidosis in this patient. Which is correct about the pathophysiology of this disease?

choices.text: Gain of function of CFTR protein

questions.text: A 50 year old man is admitted with a history of recurrent falls. Neurological assessment shows dementia with chorea. Family history shows that his father had a similar neurological illness at 60 years of age. Which of the following is correct about this disease?

In your OPD you have a tall person with long thin face, large ears, large testis and hyperextensible joints. He has an intellectual disability. Defect of which of the following chromosomes is responsible for this presentation?
Which of the following is the smallest human chromosome?
Which of the following is not an X linked dominant condition?
You are analysing a pedigree chart and come across this annotation. It implies which of the following?
Which of the following is correct about pedigree analysis?
For a diabetic patient on a follow up visit, you intend to check his KFT and electrolytes for evaluation of diabetic nephropathy. The sample will be drawn in which color vacutainer?
The following instrument tube will be used for evaluation of which of the following parameters:
Oval fat bodies on urine microscopy are seen in which of the following?
Turbid synovial fluid with 100,000 WBC/ul, 90% PMN and 10% lymphocytes with positively birefringent crystals are seen in which of the following conditions?
A 30 year old man is having massive proteinuria with edema and hypoalbuminemia. Kidney biopsy shows foot process fusion. Light microscopy is shown below. Diagnosis is
G banding in karyotyping is done for staining?
Which of the following renal cell cancer has the worst prognosis?
Leading primary malignant brain tumor of childhood?
Which of the following tumors has the highest propensity to cause tumor lysis syndrome?
Which of the following is not seen with stomach cancer?
The most common extranodal location of lymphoma is?
Bierbeck granules are seen in which of the following?
